comment: he was a nice guy, a good teacher. he is new so he still needs to work on his flow i guess. if u do the reading assignments and study properly this class will b easy.  he dresses really nice

i didnt do very good in his class but that was because i am a slacker and hate doing homework. he is a new teacher, so he doesnt quite have his rhythm down. but he has potential. the best part is definitely all the out of class activities he does. we had a cooking event that was a blast.

He's a nice guy, and he certainly tries to make class enjoyable for all involved. However, having said that, I found him to e rather unclear and a bit unorganized in his teaching methods. If that doesn't bother you, and/or you have some sort of background knowledge of the Italian language, then have at it! Otherwise I'd reconsider taking his class.

A fairly easy yet very helpful professor. Do the homework, it is easy, and don't be afraid to ask questions. He is very enthusiastic about teaching the language and goes to great lengths so you can learn it. He also likes to hang out outside of class with students, not for extra credit, but it's fun and helpful nonetheless.

I found the class to be boring. The work was super easy, and the tests were a joke. I hated the amount of homework, but it was nice to have busy work to boost your grade. Not a professor I would take again, but if you want an easy A in a foreign language, take Corradi.

I was sad when I had to drop this class (schedule probs)! Mr. Corradi is so fun and sweet. He helps a lot and really tries to expose students not only to the language but the Italian culture. He goes out of his way to help students too. :) Homework is a tedious- but it is the Quia system that sucks. I definitely recommend his class!

He is a great guy, loads of fun but he is serious about his language. Do not expect this to be like high school, you have to study outside of class. He often assigns homework so check vista often. His class is a lot of fun but you have to work hard and learn the language to earn a good grade. He is fair and I would recommend taking his class.

Mr. Corradi is a very charismatic teacher who makes the class fun. He goes out of his way to help his students (i know no other professor would do what he does to help). However, you need to check your email constantly because he does randomly drop assignments without much notice- but he is lenient on taking late work. He is also a native italian.
don't listen to the haters! prof. corradi rocks! italian is fun!

DO NOT listen to any negative comments about this prof! Besides, you can easily tell like the last 7 are written by the SAME person. Professor Corradi is THE BEST professor I've ever had @ KSU & Italian was by far my favorite class! Makes learning a language fun & worthwhile. Sincerely cares for his students & has a passion for teaching! :)

Professor Corradi is too AMAZING for words! TRUE PASSION for teaching; LOVES to see his students do well! Goes beyond out of his way to help you; always so proud of you! AWESOME teacher. He's a native of Milan, Italy. I wanted a native speaker, b/c I can learn more easily about the culture and language. Rather than having a teacher who is not a native and doesn't have the passion for the language as Prof. Corradi! As long as you DO HOMEWORK & listen in class, you can pick it up well.

Very good professor, has a lot to offer, and will jump through hoops to help you. Offers study sessions before each test and gives a study guide. Also, very well-rounded which helps when it comes to using Italian in the real world. I learned so much in one semester-I definately got my money's worth!

He's a really cool teacher. He's from Milan, and he speaks 5 different languages, so he knows how to teach a language. Pay attention and DO YOUR HOMEWORK and you'll pick up Italian pretty fast. He likes people who asks questions, so if you have ANY questions, don't hesitate to ask him! He'll be happy to help!
